info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 8:13PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Litchfield, southwestern Berkshire, Ulster, northern Dutchess, Columbia and southern Greene Counties through 845 PM EST... At 813 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Willowemoc, or 15 miles northeast of Liberty, moving northeast at 135 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kingston, Hudson, Ellenville, Catskill, Saugerties, Rhinebeck, Chatham, Hunter, Hurley, Claverack, Woodstock, Livingston, Copake, Sheffield, Coxsackie, Pine Plains, Clermont, Red Hook, Valatie and Athens. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 19 and 21. TIME...MOT...LOC 0113Z 243DEG 119KT 4199 7461 MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Albany. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EST for east central New York.
